alert.note: Alert for Caddo (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 13 at 9:21AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of west central Caddo Parish, Marion, south central Cass and central Harrison Counties through 945 AM CDT... At 920 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles southeast of Hughes Springs to 7 miles west of Berea to near Harleton. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Marshall, Waskom, Jefferson, Oil City, Mooringsport, Karnack, Lodi, Woodlawn, Smithland, Berea, Harleton, Gray, Scottsville, Uncertain, Lassater, Nesbitt, Caddo Lake, Leigh, Jonesville and Pruett. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 AM CDT for northwestern Louisiana...and northeastern Texas.
